questions.question: She has been living in ................................. Bangkok for three years.
questions.description: Articles are not normally used before the names of countries, cities or continents.

questions.question: ......................... Nile is the longest river in the world.
questions.description: Articles are used before the names of rivers.

questions.question: Some of my friends live in ............................... United States of America.
............................. Netherlands is also called ............................ Holland.
questions.description: The article the is used with United States, United Kingdom, Netherlands and United Arab Emirates.

questions.question: He spent his holidays in .............................. Alps.
questions.description: Articles are used before the names of mountain ranges.

questions.question: ............................. Andes is the longest mountain range in the world.
questions.description: Articles are used before the names of mountain ranges.

questions.question: ............................ Mount Everest is the highest mountain in the world.
questions.description: Articles are not used before the names of individual mountains.

questions.question: ............................. Bahamas is a group of islands in ............................ West Atlantic Ocean.
questions.description: Articles are used before the names of groups of islands and oceans.

questions.question: .............................. Sahara is the largest desert in the world.
............................. India is a country in ..................................
questions.description: Articles are not normally used before the names of countries, cities or continents.

questions.question: She emigrated to .............................. Canada in
questions.description: Articles are not normally used before the names of countries or cities.

questions.question: They spent their holidays on ……………………… island.
He told me ……………………… interesting story yesterday.
questions.description: Use a/an to mean one. A singular countable noun requires an article.

questions.question: He has ………………….. keen eye for detail.
……………………. life is complicated.
questions.description: We do not normally use an article with uncountable nouns when we are talking about things in general.

questions.question: …………………… minister ordered ………………………. official inquiry into ……………………… incident.
He has no interest in …………………….. politics.
questions.description: We do not normally use articles with the names of subjects.

questions.question: She learned ………………………… philosophy at university.
questions.description: We do not normally use articles with the names of subjects.

questions.question: Raju is …………………….. accomplished cook. ………………………. dinner he gave us yesterday was delicious.
I reserved ……………………. table for three.
................................ suspect was taken into …………………………. custody.
questions.description: Suspect is a singular countable noun we have to use an article with singular countable nouns there is no article in the expression take into custody.

questions.question: …………………………. person who died in ……………………… riot was ……………………. social activist.
questions.description: We use the to identify someone. A/an is an indefinite article and it does not mention who we are talking about.

questions.question: …………………….. tea is very strong. Please pour some more milk into it.
What ……………………… pity that you failed ……………………….. test.
questions.description: The correct expression is what a pity.

questions.question: Yesterday I heard ……………………. interesting story which is …………………… best I have ever heard.
questions.description: A/An can mean one use the before superlatives.

questions.question: I saw ………………………….. pretty woman in the store.
questions.description: When it is not clear which person or thing we are talking about, we use a.

questions.question: Ceylon is ………………………… island in ……………………….. Indian Ocean.
questions.description: Use a with the meaning of one.

questions.question: He has ……………………….. keen eye for detail.
He was ……………………….. only child of ……………………… rich merchant.
We expect ………………………….. official inquiry into the incident.
………………………. person who died yesterday was …………………………. heart patient.
questions.description: Use the to talk about a particular person use a when you are not talking about anyone in particular.

questions.question: Son, ‘I want ……………………… pencil.’ Mother, ‘Where is ………………………… pencil I gave you yesterday?’
questions.description: Use a when you are talking about a person or thing for the first time use the in subsequent references to that person or thing.

questions.question: I saw …………………………….. old man. He was carrying ………………………… umbrella.
May is …………………………. hottest month of ………………………. year.
questions.description: Use the with superlatives.

questions.question: There is …………………………… school for ……………………………… blind in this city.
questions.description: The blind means all blind people a school means one school.

questions.question: The world is ……………………… happy place.
questions.description: A can mean one.

questions.question: She is ……………………….. accomplished dancer.
questions.description: A/an can mean one.

questions.question: Where is ………………………… hat that I brought from London?
questions.description: We use the here because we are talking about a specific hat.

questions.question: Aluminum is …………………………. useful metal.
questions.description: We use a before a consonant sound.

questions.question: Would you open …………………………. window, please?
questions.description: We use the here because we are talking about a particular window.

questions.question: He returned after ………………………….. hour.
questions.description: We use an before vowel sounds.

questions.question: This is ………………………. answer to ……………………… problem that our teacher gave us.
Which is …………………………. longest river in the world?
questions.description: We use the before superlatives.

questions.question: He is ……………………….. close friend of mine.
I went to ………………………. school to see ……………………… principal.
questions.description: Here we are talking about a particular school and the principal there. Hence, we use the.

questions.question: She is ……………………… dancer married to ……………………….. singer.
December is ………………………….. coldest month.
questions.description: We use the superlatives.

questions.question: I met ………………………. pretty girl there.
questions.description: We use a here because the listener does not know which girl we are talking about.

questions.question: It is …………………………. interesting movie.
questions.description: We use ‘an’ here because the reader /listener does not know which movie we are talking about.

questions.question: …………………………. child is playing with his toys.
questions.description: We use the here because we are talking about a particular child.

questions.question: She is ………………………….. finest actor I have ever seen.
questions.description: We use the with superlatives.

questions.question: Can you see …………………………. cat over there?
questions.description: Either could be used here with slightly different meanings.

questions.question: She wants to be ……………………… architect.
questions.description: A/an is often used to mean one.

questions.question: There is …………………………… spider on the roof.
questions.description: A/an is often used to mean one.

questions.question: Rich people must help ……………………………….
questions.description: The poor means all poor people.

questions.question: She has ………………………….. mole on her right arm.
questions.description: A mole means one mole.

questions.question: ………………………….. train arrives at
questions.description: We are talking about a particular train here.

questions.question: If you are not feeling well, you should consult ………………………… doctor.
questions.description: Either could be used here with slightly different meaning. If we use ‘the’ it means that the listener knows which doctor we are talking about.

questions.question: He is seeing …………………………… French girl.
questions.description: The speaker does not say which French girl they are talking about. Hence, we use 'a' here.

questions.question: Is there ……………………. supermarket near your house?
questions.description: A is similar to any

questions.question: …………………………. unemployed are losing hope.
questions.description: The unemployed means all unemployed people.

questions.question: ………………………… cousin of mine is ………………………… sailor.
questions.description: A is similar to one.

questions.question: Sam is …………………………. brother of Mary.
questions.description: We use the to talk about particular people, things or places. A is similar to one.

questions.question: …………………………. lion is ……………………. king of beasts.
questions.description: The is used to generalize things.

questions.question: ………………………… rich must help ……………………. poor
questions.description: The rich means all rich people.

questions.question: Can I have ………………………. copy of this book?
questions.description: A copy means one copy.

questions.question: Yesterday I received …………………………. letter from ………………………. old friend.
My sister wants to be …………………………… architect.
questions.description: Use an before vowel sounds.

questions.question: I have ………………………….. cousin who wants to be ………………………… singer.
She is married to …………………….. eminent doctor.
questions.description: Use an before vowel sounds.

questions.question: ……………………….. girl I met in the store was very pretty.
questions.description: Use the to talk about particular people or things.

questions.question: Is there ……………………. restaurant near ……………………… the house you live in?
questions.description: A is similar to any we use the to talk about particular people, things or places.

questions.question: We must help …………………………. needy.
questions.description: The needy means all needy people.

questions.question: ………………………… daughter of my friend is ……………………….. accomplished dancer.
questions.description: We use the to talk about particular people, things or places. A is similar to one.

questions.question: Samuel, ………………………. brother of Mary is ……………………… artist.
questions.description: We use the to talk about particular people, things or places. A is similar to one.

questions.question: ………………………… cow is ………………………. useful animal.
questions.description: The is used to generalize things.

questions.question: ………………………… rich are not always happy.
questions.description: The rich means all rich people.

questions.question: He gave me …………………………. copy of ……………………….. Bible.
questions.description: A copy means one copy.

questions.question: He received …………………….. message from ……………………….. king.
Man is ………………………… only animal that uses fire.
The train was late by ………………………… hour.
questions.description: Use an before vowel sounds.

questions.question: She is married to …………………………. European.
questions.description: Use a before consonant sounds.

questions.question: What did you do with ……………………….. money I lent you?
questions.description: Use the to talk about particular people or things.

questions.question: What kind of …………………… is it?
questions.description: When a common noun is used in its widest sense, it is used without an article.

questions.question: …………………….. is mortal.
questions.description: When a common noun is used in its widest sense, it is used without an article.

questions.question: ………………………. grows in many parts of India.
questions.description: Articles are omitted before material nouns.

questions.question: ……………………… is a useful metal.
questions.description: Articles are omitted before material nouns.

questions.question: He was ………………………….. of his age.
questions.description: Sometimes an article is used with proper nouns when they are used as common nouns.

questions.question: Mumbai is ……………………….. of India.
questions.description: Sometimes an article is used with proper nouns when they are used as common nouns.

questions.question: ……………………… is its own reward.
questions.description: Articles are usually omitted before abstract nouns.

questions.question: He is fluent in ……………………..
questions.description: Articles are omitted before the names of languages.

questions.question: My friend is still in ……………………….
questions.description: Articles are omitted before nouns like hospital and school when the reference is to the primary purpose of these places.

questions.question: I went to ……………………….. to see my friend.
questions.description: Articles are used before the nouns hospital and school when we are talking about these places as a building or structure.

questions.question: …………………….. has returned.
questions.description: Articles are omitted before names of relations.

questions.question: I met him at ……………………….
questions.description: Here the club is merely a meeting place and hence an article is used with that.

questions.question: ………………… teacher needs patience.
questions.description: We can use a/an to talk about any member of a class.

questions.question: I lost ……………………. book which I borrowed from you.
questions.description: We are talking about a particular book here hence we use the.

questions.question: ………………….. spider has eight legs.
……………………. Nile is the longest river in the world.
questions.description: Articles are used with the names of rivers.

questions.question: There is ………………….. library in the town.
questions.description: A can be used in the numerical sense of one.

questions.question: It was ……………………… finest day of my life.
questions.description: The article the is used before superlatives.

questions.question: She can play …………………… piano.
questions.description: The article the is used with the names of musical instruments.

questions.question: Should ……………………. police carry guns?
questions.description: The article the is often used to refer to certain well-known groups of people.

questions.question: …………………… baby cow can stand as soon as it is born.
questions.description: A singular countable noun requires an article or another determiner with it.

questions.question: I prefer ……………………. country to ……………………. town.
questions.description: We use the with expressions referring to the physical environment.

questions.question: English people always talk about ………………….. weather.
I watched ……………………. movie yesterday.
questions.description: We do not say which movie it was. Hence we use the indefinite article a here.

questions.question: ……………. are useful devices.
questions.description: We do not use ‘the’ with plural nouns to talk about things in general.

questions.question: I love …………………
questions.description: We do not use ‘the’ with plural nouns to talk about things in general.

questions.question: ………………. birds can fly.
questions.description: When most means ‘the majority of’, it is used without the.

questions.question: Mother is in ……………… She has kidney trouble.
questions.description: We use 'the' with hospital only when the reference is to the building.

questions.question: Both …………….. are good at painting.
questions.description: We often leave out ‘the’ after both.

questions.question: All ……………… robbers have been arrested.
questions.description: We often leave out ‘the’ between all and a number.

questions.question: The number of …………….. has increased rapidly.
questions.description: ‘The’ is dropped after ‘the number of’ or ‘the amount of’.

questions.question: Who is that on ……………….?
questions.description: The article ‘the’ is common with the names of musical instruments.

questions.question: It is not easy to produce programs for …………….
questions.description: Articles are generally used with radio, cinema and theater.

questions.question: What …………….. idea!
questions.description: We use’a/an’ with singular countable nouns in exclamations after what.

questions.question: Can you get that cat off …………….?
questions.description: Articles are used with TV when the reference is to a television set.

questions.question: I am getting ……………
questions.description: 'A toothache' is more common in American English.

questions.question: ........................... is the longest river in the world.
questions.description: We use the article 'the' before the names of rivers, mountains etc.

questions.question: ............................ is one of the largest lakes in Africa.
questions.description: We do not normally use articles with lakes.

questions.question: ......................... is the highest peak in the world.
questions.description: Articles are not normally used with the names single mountains.

questions.question: .......................... are an example of a folded mountain range.
questions.description: The article 'the' is used with the names of mountain groups.

questions.question: .......................... is the largest desert in the world.
questions.description: The article 'the' is used with the names of deserts.

questions.question: He was my classmate at .......................................
questions.description: 'The' is not normally used in the titles of major universities and principal public buildings.

questions.question: We are going to ........................ for summer.
questions.description: We do not use articles with the names of countries.

questions.question: Mandarin is the official language of .............................................
questions.description: Countries whose names contain common nouns like state, union or republic usually take the article 'the'.

questions.question: London is on ............................
questions.description: We use 'the' with the names of rivers.

questions.question: .......................... attracts thousands of visitors each day.
questions.description: We use 'the' with the names of most museums and art galleries.

questions.question: His brother lives in ..........................
questions.description: We do not use articles with the names of continents, countries, states, counties etc.

questions.question: ......................... is the largest continent in the world.
questions.description: We do not use articles with the names of continents.

When ……………… sets, darkness descends.
The birds were pecking at ………………
I will never forget your acts of ………………..

………………. arrived on time.
Give me ……………….
………………….. man is mortal.
I am …………………. university student.
She goes to the temple in ……………….. mornings.
Kiran is …………………. best student in the class.
………………….. camel is the ship of the desert.
This book has won ………………….. Booker prize.
Harishchandra was …………………. honest king.
I am fond of ………………. classical music.
I met ..................... boy in the store.
Gold is ....................... precious metal.
She returned after ………………….. hour.
There is ..................... . institution for ....................... blind in this city.
If you are really hungry, you can eat ……………… apple.
She went on to become ………………….. successful playback singer.
………………… library on the corner has an amazing collection of story books.
I don’t speak ………………… Hindi very well, but I can make myself understood.
She is ………………… prettiest girl I have ever seen.
‘Where is ………………… cheese?’ ‘I ate it.’
Move ………………… books off that chair and sit down.
………………… . Irish have their own language.
………………. life is complicated.
I am writing ………………… book on Indian mythology.
Gold is ……………………….. precious metal.
Honest men speak ……………………….. truth.
He looks as stupid as ……………………….. owl.
I would like to meet Brad Pit, …………………. actor.
What did you do with ……………………… camera I lent you?
He is going out with ………………………… German girl.
He remained ………………………… bachelor all his life.
‘What is that noise?’ ‘I think it is ……………………….. helicopter.’
I waited for ………………………….. hour and then I went home.
She showed me …………………………. one-pound coin.
